info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 1:17PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Missoula and northern Granite Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 116 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southwest of Ovando to 10 miles northwest of Drummond. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Locations impacted include... Garnet and Greenough. This includes Highway 200 E between mile markers 23 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
